item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (318 points | 222 comments)
2. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (11 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (81 points | 27 comments)
4. Apple Card Disabled My iCloud, App Store, and Apple ID Accounts (64 points | 28 comments)
5. Show HN: A web browser agent in your Chrome side panel (70 points | 40 comments)
6. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (79 points | 4 comments)
7. Working with Git Patches in Apple Mail (2023) (27 points | 8 comments)
8. Coding without a laptop: Two weeks with AR glasses and Linux on Android (863 points | 321 comments)
9. Measure EEG with Arduino (8 points | 1 comment)
10. Magic Leap One Bootloader Exploit (18 points | 1 comment)
11. Pluto Flyover from New Horizons (13 points | 2 comments)
12. The Conquest of Hell Gate [pdf] (38 points | 3 comments)
13. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (294 points | 146 comments)
14. Solar grants held hostage in Pennsylvania legislature – as demand soars (12 points | 3 comments)
15. Paper Mechanisms (33 points | 1 comment)
16. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (131 points | 93 comments)
17. How the Sun Enterprise 10000 was born (2007) (40 points | 28 comments)
18. Lessons from Mixing Rust and Java: Fast, Safe, and Practical (95 points | 24 comments)
19. High Available Mosquitto MQTT on Kubernetes (27 points | 12 comments)
20. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (58 points | 30 comments)
21. Mystical (310 points | 38 comments)
22. Experts have it easy (2024) (160 points | 75 comments)
23. Craft Basic (Windows 95 and up) (38 points | 5 comments)
24. Show HN: Turn any workflow diagram into compilable, running and stateful code (82 points | 18 comments)
25. State of the Art PFAS [pdf] (16 points | 2 comments)
26. Show HN: Chat with 19 years of HN (60 points | 36 comments)
27. If nothing is curated, how do we find things (295 points | 211 comments)
28. How to have the browser pick a contrasting color in CSS (235 points | 68 comments)
29. Dead Stars Don’t Radiate (230 points | 118 comments)
30. Palette lighting tricks on the Nintendo 64 (209 points | 47 comments)
